Pre-Game Insights: Australia captain Pat Cummins confirmed that Sunday’s World Cup final will be played on a ‘used surface’.
The black soil pitch that was used for India’s game against Pakistan last month will be persisted with.
Cummins referred to the pitch as a ‘pretty good wicket’.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A black soil track, rolled heavily to ensure slowness, is on offer.
Batting will be difficult under the lights if opposition has two quality spinners operating in the middle overs.
